claim: the australian open and the french open have the same result in 1996 and 1990
the us open have the same result in the year 1986 and 1999
resp:

1. Identify the tournament from the table that corresponds to the US Open. In our table, it is the last row labeled "us open".
2. Compare the results (rounds reached) in the same column for both years 1986 and 1999. In the case of the US Open, the round reached for these two years can be found in the 4th and 13th columns of the "data" array respectively.
3. Examine the values at those specific cells (i.e., the 4th column of the 2nd row and the 13th column of the 4th row). The values for the years 1986 and 1999 in the US Open data are "1r" and "1r".

Since the results for both years are different, the claim is FALSE.

Final Answer:

2. In the row with index 1 (representing 1990), the results for each tournament are stored in the cells "a", "sf", "3r", and "3r".
3. In the row with index 12 (representing 1999), the results for each tournament are stored in the cells "1r", "qf", "qf", and "3r".
4. The cells for 1990 and 1999 do not have identical values for all tournaments, as the Australian Open result is "a" in 1990 and "1r" in 1999, and the Wimbledon result is "sf" in 1990 and "3r" in 1999.
5. Therefore, each tournament does not have the same result in the years 1990 and 1999.
